text: If I paste the URL of my blog into Wordle, I get the cloud below. Predictably the key words are learning, thinking, inquiry, creativity and community – I write about what matters to me.  I’m curious what the key words might be in some of my favourite (and less favourite) blogs and spend a bit of time investigating some well-known ones. The results are interesting and I confess to being a little surprised that learning doesn’t feature more in educators’ blogs. Here’s a sample… (Guess which one is a class blog!)
Ed,What a wonderful idea – just done it 😉 You is right 😉Now, I’m off to do one for the “Ministry of TESTUcation” here….!Be good…T..
Reblogged this on all about learning… and commented:I just did the same thing, copied and pasted my URL web blogs and Voila!!!
Great idea! What matters to you is what matters the most!
Reblogged this on StevenSutantro Blog and commented:Cool Ideas! It summarizes our mind easily and interestingly!
Thanks. A very practical use of Wordle. It inspired me to review my year’s blogging the same way.
